org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.processors.cassandra

Class CassandraProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.processors.cassandra.CassandraProperties

  • public class CassandraProperties
extends Object
    This class specifies properties specific to the Cassandra Processor.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CassandraProperties()
      Constructs an empty set of Cassandra properties, with most values being set to null, 0, or empty (depending on the type of the property).
      CassandraProperties(CassandraProperties properties)
      Creates a set of Cassandra properties from an existing set of Cassandra properties, making a defensive copy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CassandraProperties

        public CassandraProperties()
        Constructs an empty set of Cassandra properties, with most values being set to null, 0, or empty (depending on the type of the property). Usually this constructor is used if this configuration POJO is populated in an automated fashion (e.g. injection). If you need to build them manually (possibly with defaults), use or create a properties builder.

        You can change the defaults with the setters.

        See Also:
        MapBasedCassandraPropsBuilder.buildDefault(), MapBasedCassandraPropsBuilder.build(Map)

      • CassandraProperties

        public CassandraProperties(CassandraProperties properties)
        Creates a set of Cassandra properties from an existing set of Cassandra properties, making a defensive copy.
        Parameters:
        properties - The set of properties to copy
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When properties is null
        See Also:
        ()

    • Method Detail

      • getInsertEventCqlStmt

        public final String getInsertEventCqlStmt()
        Returns:
        The event CQL "INSERT" statement (event table)
        See Also:
        setInsertEventCqlStmt(String)

      • setInsertEventCqlStmt

        public final void setInsertEventCqlStmt(String insertEventCqlStmt)
        Set the CQL statement to insert event records in the event table.

        The CQL statement must be parameterized, and it must use named parameters. It must also explicitly specify the keyspace as keyspace.tablename.

        Parameters:
        insertEventCqlStmt - The CQL statement used to insert audit events to the database
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the insertEventCqlStmt is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the insertEventCqlStmt is empty

      • getEventIdCqlParam

        public final String getEventIdCqlParam()
        Returns:
        The name of the "event ID" field parameter in the event CQL "INSERT" statement (event table)
        See Also:
        setEventIdCqlParam(String)

      • setEventIdCqlParam

        public final void setEventIdCqlParam(String eventIdCqlField)
        Set the name of the "event ID" parameter in the event CQL "INSERT" parameterized statement when creating new event records in the event table.

        The value of this configuration setting must match a named parameter in the CQL "INSERT" parameterized statement.

        Note that this field is not necessarily equal to the column name.

        Parameters:
        eventIdCqlField - The name of the "event ID" field in the event CQL "INSERT" statement (event table)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the insertEventCqlStmt is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the insertEventCqlStmt is empty

      • getAuditStreamNameCqlParam

        public final String getAuditStreamNameCqlParam()
        Returns:
        The name of the "audit stream name" field parameter in the event CQL "INSERT" statement (event table)
        See Also:
        setAuditStreamNameCqlParam(String)

      • setAuditStreamNameCqlParam

        public final void setAuditStreamNameCqlParam(String auditStreamNameCqlField)
        Set the name of the "audit stream name" parameter in the event CQL "INSERT" parameterized statement when creating new event records in the event table.

        The value of this configuration setting must match a named parameter in the CQL "INSERT" parameterized statement.

        Note that this field is not necessarily equal to the column name.

        Parameters:
        auditStreamNameCqlField - The name of the "audit stream name" field in the event CQL "INSERT" statement
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the insertEventCqlStmt is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the insertEventCqlStmt is empty

      • setEventJsonCqlParam

        public final void setEventJsonCqlParam(String eventJsonCqlField)
        Set the name of the "event JSON" parameter in the event CQL "INSERT" parameterized statement when creating new event records in the event table.

        The value of this configuration setting must match a named parameter in the CQL "INSERT" parameterized statement.

        Note that this field is not necessarily equal to the column name.

        Parameters:
        eventJsonCqlField - The name of the "event JSON" field in the event CQL "INSERT" statement (event table)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the insertEventCqlStmt is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the insertEventCqlStmt is empty

      • getEventIdFieldName

        public final String getEventIdFieldName()
        Returns:
        the name of the field holding a unique event ID
        See Also:
        setEventIdFieldName(String)

      • setEventIdFieldName

        public final void setEventIdFieldName(String eventIdFieldName)
        The name of the field in the event that holds a unique event ID.

        This event ID can be created e.g. with the `org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.processors.eventid.EventIdProcessor` processor.

        Note that the field (referenced in the INSERT CQL statements both for the events table and the search table) that holds this value must be long enough to accept a value of the maximum length possible for the value configured here.

        Parameters:
        eventIdFieldName - the length of the (random) event ID generated by this processor (must be greater 0)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the eventIdFieldName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the eventIdFieldName is empty

      • getSessionName

        public final String getSessionName()
        Returns:
        the name of the Cassandra session attribute
        See Also:
        setSessionName(String)

      • setSessionName

        public final void setSessionName(String sessionName)
        The name of the Cassandra session attribute in the ProcessingObjects of the CassandraProcessor.process(org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.common.Event, String, org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.common.ProcessingObjects) method (this processor is always connecting to a Cassandra session that is provided by the integrating application).
        Parameters:
        sessionName - the name of the session attribute
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the sessionName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the sessionName is empty

      • getAdditionalProperties

        public final Map<String,String> getAdditionalProperties()
        Returns:
        Any additional properties stored in this object that have not explicitly been parsed
        See Also:
        setAdditionalProperties(Map)

      • setAdditionalProperties

        public final void setAdditionalProperties(Map<String,String> additionalProperties)
        Any additional properties which have not been parsed, and for which no getter/setter exists, but are to be stored in this object nevertheless.

        This property is commonly used to preserve original properties from upstream components that are to be passed on to downstream components unchanged. This properties set may or may not include properties that have been extracted from the map, and been made available through this POJO.

        Note that these additional properties may be null or empty, even in a fully populated POJO where other properties commonly have values assigned to.

        Parameters:
        additionalProperties - The additional properties to store
